intro: Bumelia myrsinifolia, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and numerous stamens. Bumelia myrsinifolia is often found in moist, wooded areas and can thrive in partial shade.
